intro: Canthium glabrum var. puberulum, commonly known as the rough canthium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
